description: Not only it forces you to install addons to avoid bing & google but it relaunches the devils upon removing them as search engines. Doesn't allow you to write down your custom searches but it has to cog memory as an additional built-in applications that may or may not work. Also will, at any moment, disable the security addons to show ads and unwanted content. No, thanks.
summary: Won't protect much against the corporate hells

description:
I am suddenly having problems to read zimbra-based e-mails. When I open an e-mail, it seems empty. When I repond to it or forward it, I can read what was send.

No problem when I open the mails in another browser...

I just set the browser to clear my offline website data upon closing. It updated to cancel this separate option and bind it with cookies. Now I have to log in to any website every time or let the websites abuse my data and privacy.
best video game ever

Would have given 5 stars, but Firefox 128 adds the "Privacy Preserving Attribution API", which is a good idea in theory but should not have been turned on by default. For many Firefox users, privacy is of great importance, and this feature erodes that privacy regardless of how anonymous it is purported to be. 

I still recommend Firefox over any other major browser, but if you use it you should consider going into privacy settings and unchecking the "Allow web sites to perform privacy-preserving ad measurement" box.
summary: Thanks for breaking up the Chromium monopoly

description: every year is another chip away at their users' privacy and another win for their bloated and overpaid management.
Best Web browser and much better then Chrome!
Probably the only "popular' browser worth using.

Unless you get to work on disabling several functions, it now sends a lot of telemetry. It insist on using Google as default. Its not even as faster as other browser. I am saddened by the state of Firefozx. It does not offer anything more to compete wit other browsers. Librewolf in my mind is what Firefox used to be.
Works well here, and even better with BetterFox profile
It works as a browser. Webpages load when you have an internet connection. I honestly don't know what to write here.
runs fine from dektop but not from bar
summary: canbt run from pin to taskbar

description:
i used this browser for a long time, but now they sell browser data without asking first. 
Mozilla does not take a good care of this piece of ...software: there are 6 years old unfixed bugs regarding developer toolchain, meaning developers would think twice before testing their websites with this ..software, there are even older bugs regarding commonly used media formats, chrome can do them.. chrome by the way exists because Mozilla didn't do their job well, so KDE wrote Chrome's predecesor which is now the only "useable" browser - i think its still worse regarding privacy than this piece of ..software, but that bar is somwhere near earth's core.
Great browser, has lots of useful and privacy oriented extensions in the extension gallery.

...that isn't chromium.

Firefox is the only browser left that isn't chromium. There is nowhere else, at least in the near future, to which our species could migrate. Visit, yes. Settle, not yet. Like it or not, for the moment Firefox is where we make our stand.

It has been said that running free software is a humbling and character-building experience. There is perhaps no better demonstration of the folly of human conceits than the dystopian image of a Google controlled future. To me, it underscores our responsibility to deal more kindly with one another, and to preserve and cherish the cherished and beloved fox, the only home we've ever known.
everithing works as expected
Most definetly the best browser out there!!
Uninstalling due to the Mozilla foundations support of Putins government censorship.
good good goodv
One of my fav browser of all time, after you change like 10 settings and install some addons. Deafult firefox just isnt that good. Install ublock origin, disable pocket and all telemetry.
After playing vidoes for awhile all of Firefox will freeze or crash. You cannot recover it and it requires a restart of the application.
If you want a fulling working adblocker (Not the dumbed down ones that crome based browsers use) you gotta go firefox.
The Flathub version does not work. It will not sync bookmarks, or anything for that matter. I've tried signing in and re-signing in and nothing works. Avoid it at all costs.
Unusable in Gamemode on SteamDeck, but works smothly in Desktop mode.
Always when I try to download files from this flatpak version of firefox I can't download or even save images when right clicked.

Slower and slower. updates without warning and not within OS schedule.
resets setttings to backstab your privacy.
Google hates it for youtube.

Firefox is great. Use it on Windows, too (if your stuck with that garbage at work like many of us...). Been using "Firefox" (or Opera before they gave in) since it was Netscape Navigator.
Don't believe the shills ('john' ...). 
We need competition to Google's engine and Chromium-based browsers for a healthy web. Use Firefox. Webkit is meh... I've only ever had buggy behavior with mobile versions. (seriously though, fix that Android release...)
The Flatpak is fine. Or use your distro's package if it's fresh enough.
summary: Competition is historically proven to be better for everybody

description:
'Abrowser' is the default browser that comes with GnuLinux Trisquel 9.0. Firefox browser is not generally installable to Trisquel (presumably because there is something proprietary as part of that app), but Flatpak did offer it so I gave it a try. 

I haven't used the Firefox it installed yet, however I noticed immediately that Abrowser is partially broken...requires reloading YouTube for a video to play, or sometimes the progress bar stalls when loading a video to play. In any case, no such issues were present before installing Firefox via Flatpak.

I don't know if uninstalling Firefox may resolve the problem(s), but in any case its addition still does 'break' Abrowser (ostensibly a more privacy-oriented fork off of Firefox.)
i installed ffmpeg but dont work flassh video

I am baffled as to why such junk is permitted on the software arena - LOOK AT THE FILE SIZE 1.5 GB ! 

Firefox browser is no more than 240 MB.

I don't understand why users can't report apps, or plug-ins on this unbelievably unsafe software 'store'.

Version is missing, can anyone confirm version number ?

Firefox is always good, older versions have more support for plugins/extensions and most up to date version always has lots of speed and other optimizations.

description: it works with my native package manager :(

I love firefox, and have used it for decades. Lately memory ussage is just massive. Just closed the thing and it freed 5G ram, only after one day of browsing sessions, perhaps 10-20 tabs, it is insane. I went to mozilla support and the suggestion is to uninstall extensions and/or add ram.
Now that Firefox Quantum is not only available on Flatpak, but also Wayland and VA-API compatible, it's just the best browsing experience on Linux, hands down.
After install it says in the settings that it's being "managed by my organization". Not sure why. Uninstalled.

I'm a user of all major web browsers. Firefox is my daily driver on most OS's. Because at work we use Google Cloud Platform, and Google's cloud console is broken on Firefox, I have chrome open on the same machine, as well. Further, Gmail/Gsuite are a superior experience within Chrome versus Firefox.

But that experience isn't better because Chrome is better: it's due to shoddy frontend engineering practices on Google's part (across the board w.r.t. their product engineering, sans their non-frontend engineering teams). 

So do your part and avoid allowing Google to profit from your data pipeline. There's a better world out there for you and Firefox is probably a part of it.
Its low in resources (especially on Linux) and that best inbuilt privacy features. uBlock is most performant on Firefox.
I've been using Firefox Flatpak for more than 6 months, and everything works as intended. Good work developers!
Great privacy controls.

description: До этого постоянно пользовался firefox, даже и на windows и на mint, и на ubuntu, и на arch, но вот после предпоследнего обновления вообще не грузит видео в браузере (сейчас я на fedora, но и в arch, и в windows тоже самое)... И поддержка отмахивается (я написал, они мне отослали ссылку на issue на github, где моя проблема не решается) и даже после недавнего обновления ничего не исправилось. Перехожу на vivaldi
отличное приложение
Надеюсь в этом дистрибутиве всё ок, перешёл с убунты, Радуют Русские коменты, Всем Хорошего времени суток!
прекрасно работает
При старте, приложение уходит работать в фоне. Не открывая сам интерфейс... Если прибить процесс и запустить браузер снова, работает нормально. Слшком много действий, что бы открыть браузер. Удаляю
Все поголовно версии глючные...разочарован
медленный, неудобный
После выхода осенних (23-го года) версий превратился в полное говно. Как утырки выкатывают новое обновление - перестаёт работать. Извольте обновлять ))) А мне их обновления на хрен не сдались.
Последний браузер не для домохозяек. Дополнения (особенно блокировщик рекламы uBlock Origin) лучше, чем в хроме. Всё настраивается на свой вкус.
был неплохой браузер, но теперь раз в недельку по приколу стирает мой аккаунт

這款瀏覽企安全也好用，然而還有不少問題要克服 希望能夠改進 我將列在以下：
1.希望客製化能夠更全面『像是google的柳覽器首頁也有圖』
2.能更加速網頁的載入速度
3.增加其他柳覽器也有的功能 例：側邊欄等等
4.可以參考不同瀏覽器的功能移植近來 但不主動開啟如背景音樂

我希望有一天它能成為我推薦大部分人的首選原因不是其他小眾原因
而是它不只更好還在意你的安全
by 小康
summary: 希望能更追上其他瀏覽器

同样是74的版本
fedora安装没有mozilla官网直接下载的好用。
fedora的有2个缺陷
1：收藏夹高度过长没有限制高度
2：右下角右键单击会自动打开
官网下载的压缩版没有这2个缺陷
